title: Gorka Marquez will finally return to Strictly Come Dancing floor
text:
Strictly Come Dancing favourite Gorka will return (Picture: Instagram/Getty)

Gorka Marquez will be returning to Strictly Come Dancing, hooray!

The popular dancing professional will return for the Children In Need special, and has been partnered with EastEnders actress Louisa Lytton.

On Tuesday Louisa shared snaps of the pair in the rehearsal studio, and Gorka shared them and appeared over the moon to be dancing again.

‘First day of rehearsals with @louisanastrilytton done. EXCITED to be back on the dance floor for @bbccin show @bbcstrictly #bbccin #childreninneed #strictly,’ he captioned the picture.

Louisa added: ‘Well here we go then!! I can’t remember a SINGLE step from my strictly experience 13 years ago but boy is this going to be fun!’

‘Well here we go then!!’ said Louisa (Picture: Instagram)

Louisa competed in the fourth series of Strictly at the age of 17-years-old, finishing in fourth place with partner Vincent Simone.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Louisa will be joined by EastEnders pals Maisie Smith, Rudolph Walker and Ricky Champ who are all also swapping Albert Square for the special competition next month.

The Walford residents will be battling it out for the highly-coveted Pudsey glitterball trophy.

Maisie, who plays Tiffany Butcher, will be paired with last year’s main series champion Kevin Clifton, while Ricky will be trying his luck with Luba Mushtuk.

Meanwhile Rudolph, aka the iconic Patrick Trueman, will be the oldest contestant in the show’s history and will be joining forces with newcomer Nancy Xu.

Gorka has been a long-time fan favourite on the BBC One show and fans were particularly miffed when Kevin Clifton stepped in for Neil Jones, who was forced to pull out amid injury, and not Gorka.

‘Gorka is noticeably missing this series! @bbcstrictly you could of give Gorka the chance to stand in for Neil,’ tweeted one fan while another added: ‘If Neil’s having to have a replacement pro this week, why couldn’t it be Gorka or Graziano?’

‘Big mistake, Gorka should have been the stand-in for Neil,’ shared another.

Even former professional James Jordan got in on the act, adding: ‘Shame they didn’t use Gorka to step in for Neil.’

It appears Gorka is in agreement with Strictly viewers, as he’s been busy retweeting multiple messages from fans calling out producers for picking Kevin.

Advertisement

Advertisement

One tweet read: ‘Should have be Gorks not #kingkev.’

Another said: ‘Why have extra pros and not use them. Ermmmm hello @gorkamarquez1 deserved it not Kevin who has already had a partner this year #StrictlyComeDancing.’

Awks.

Strictly Come Dancing continues this Saturday at 7pm on BBC One.
